title: Wolf and elk populations in Yellowstone 3

content.question: Based on the data, which of the following behaviors in elk could account for the differences between the percent of aspens browsed by herbivores and the height of aspen trees in riparian and upland environments?

choices.label: Elk tend to avoid riparian areas where the steep, wooded riverbanks make it difficult to escape predators.
Elk tend to prefer riparian areas where there is easy access to water.
Elk tend to avoid upland areas where trees are too tall to be easily eaten.
Elk tend to prefer upland areas where there are richer sources of mineral nutrients, such as potassium and iodine.

content.answer: Elk tend to avoid riparian areas where the steep, wooded riverbanks make it difficult to escape predators.

skill.text: 2.B: Explain relationships between characteristics of biological models in both theoretical and applied contexts.
